intro: Limonium namaquanum, commonly known as the Namibian bluebell, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Namibia and Angola. It is characterized by its striking blue to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Limonium namaquanum belongs to the Plumbagaceae family and is known for its compact, low-growing habit. Its unique appearance and ecological resilience make it a notable species in its native habitat.
